segments.text: I see the woman in her apron, blissfully unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she polishes that plate with such devotion is almost touching.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I feel anger bubbling inside me as I see the water flowing over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Does she really not see the danger beneath her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that shaky stool, and I can’t breathe as I watch him fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl, standing there, her hand raised expectantly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost as if she knows what she’s doing is wrong, but she doesn’t care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookies are tempting, but they aren’t worth the risk of falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene feels like it’s building towards disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could reach out and pull the boy down safely.
segments.speaker: PAR
